project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello team,

We have a feature request for adding the "Assignee" column for the issues shown on Sprint Report, on the new Boards. Is that a possibility to add it? It would be awesome if the users could be able to customize the columns to be shown, similar with the dashboard gadgets or the issue navigator.

Thanks,
Arthur Gonçalves

Just want to add some more examples regarding to the columns:
* A column with the "UserName" of the user that caused the event. 
* "Summary" column shows issue summary
fields.summary: Add column for "Assignee" on Sprint Report Burndown Chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, 
we have following situation:
1. one team works on several projects/products
2. several team can work on the same product backlog.

To do this,
1. the "team perspective /view" on the planning is needed ("bottom-up"). 
- several upcoming Sprints can be created (e.g., one year sprint schedule) (for each Team). Issues from different projects can be scheduled/per-liminary planned for these Sprints (e.g., based on Team Velocity)
- Upcoming Sprint should be visible also in Issues Edit modus and searchable in JQL
- As soon as an Issue is scheduled/planned for an Upcoming Sprint(s) in Team-Board, the respective Sprints are shown in Product Backlog Board (for 6.0.3 it is possible only for started Sprints)

2. Product Backlog or Release perspective/view on planning (top-down). 
- Product Manager should be able to plan the Product Backlog /Release Backlog on Sprints (also Upcoming Sprints)
- As soon as an Issue is scheduled/planned for Upcoming Sprints, it appears in respective Team Backlog (s) (consider also case with several Teams working on the same product backlog).

Thank you
German
fields.summary: As Product Manager/Dev. Manager, I need both Team-based planning and Product -based planning for Upcoming Sprints.

fields.description:
I have seen this on GDOG, and on my own spun-up OD instance.

# Start up JIRA OnDemand. I used jira-master fireball #569. This has GH version 6.0.2-rc1 bundled.
# Install GH 6.0.4-SNAPSHOT into the instance
# External System Import does not work - clicking on a system to import from returns a 500 page with the following stack trace:

{code}
Cause: 
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.extensions.ExternalSystemImporterModuleDescriptor cannot be cast to com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.extensions.ExternalSystemImporterModuleDescriptor
Stack Trace: [hide]
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.extensions.ExternalSystemImporterModuleDescriptor cannot be cast to com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.extensions.ExternalSystemImporterModuleDescriptor
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.wizard.TabsSimpleLinkFactory.getLinks(TabsSimpleLinkFactory.java:53)

	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor555.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl$AbstractMultiTenantAwareInvocationHandler.invokeInternal(MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl.java:181)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl$MultiTenantAwareInvocationHandler.invoke(MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl.java:211)
	at $Proxy309.getLinksForSection(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor555.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
	at $Proxy309.getLinksForSection(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor555.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)

It appears to be a class loader issue. But I'm not too familiar with the code.

fields.description:
Repro steps:
1 - set the swimlanes to use queries
2 - add a query
3 - Change swimlanes to use something else
4 - change it back to queries

Expected - to see the query that was added previously
Actual - no queries listed
Note: page refresh lists the queries

Deleted queries also continue to appear until the page is refreshed - repro
1 - set the swimlanes to use to queries
2 - add a query
3 - refresh page
4 - delete the query
5 - change swimlanes to use something else
6 - change it back to queries

Expected - deleted query doesn't show up
Actual - deleted query is in the list. And it has a remove button, which then does nothing.
fields.summary: Queries for swimlanes are not updated properly after changing configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Only a problem when:
* {{sprint}} is specified; AND
* {{sprint}} is a number; AND
* {{sprint}} does not correspond to a sprint ID in the entire system

So it is *not* a problem when:
* {{sprint}} is not a number; OR
* {{sprint}} is a sprint ID that is known in the database

Customers would not run into this problem, unless they restored data which was missing sprints, and did not clear their browser caches.
fields.summary: Invalid sprint ID in URL parameter causes errors

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I emailed a bit with Shaun Clowes in the GH feedback form, but really feel this deserves a Story. At least five people in our company (two project managers, product manager, release manager and QA manager) have all independently complained to Atlassian or myself about this deficiency (the Agile board is coming along nicely, don't get us wrong!).

Now with sprints decoupled from Fix Versions, there is no easy way to see on the Agile Plan, Work or Report tab which issues are designated for which release. The Classic pages had this as you could easily add Fix Version as data to each card as well as click between Fix Version buckets on the right to see what was going where. We do sprints and of course usually have a release at the end of the sprint, but most of the time there are a few releases during the sprint. Looking at the Work tab, you have zero idea which items are slated for which release. Also, now that Classic is deprecated, you have to cross reference with some JIRA filters and your Work tab to see which issues have an assigned Fix Version.

I propose the ability to see the Fix Version on the Work tab, or have some type of Release tab so we can see which issues are slated for which Fix Versions easily. There's probably a better solution, but just looking for some visibility into Fix Version.

Shaun said we could use Card Colors to denote this, but that isn't going to work as
# the colors will mean nothing to most people and we'll constantly have to look at the legend in the Configure tab to make any sense of them
# we'll have to update the Fix Version filters for each card color after each release (thus making #1 even worse since colors will change)

Thoughts?
fields.summary: As a project/release manager, I don't have visibility into Fix Version for my sprint's issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- What does this look like without the "Epics" column? - The whole plan mode just goes across the screen

Scenarios / Requirements

* Behaviour in plan and work mode should now be more consistent ... 
* Plan and Work mode details are independent, i.e. when opening issue A in Plan and issue B in Work, flicking between the two should preserve the open issues. 
* Opening and closing details in plan and work mode are independent, i.e. closing detail in plan mode should not close it in work mode and vice versa.
* On initial load, the backlog will fill the screen - the plan mode content block is gone for good. 
* Deselecting an issue in plan mode has the same effect as closing it. 
* Clicking on an issue in plan mode now just selects it and no longer opens the issue detail. However if it's already opened then it will refresh to the currently selected issue (same behaviour as work mode).
* If a filter is applied and the selected issue is filtered out then issue detail is closed. 
* Multi-select - if issue detail is open, display the last selected issue. If it's closed, don't open it. 


(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if an inline edit is open?
A: Changes should be saved and then detail closed. 

Q: Will it have an XBox™ to close akin to work mode?
A: Oui

Q: What if there is an error in plan mode when you try to close it?
A: It should not close until the error is fixed. 
Example: Edit the estimate and put some letters in the field (not allowed) - currently the error appears inline, then on close appears at the top. 

Q: Do the cards resize nicely without detail view?
A: They will stretch across the page

Q: Same keyboard shortcut? If so, is there any collision with S + T?
A: Shortcut will be T. ST should rank the issue without showing the issue detail if it's not open. If it is, ST selects the next issue that was below the one that moved so this would then appear in the detail view. 

Q: How performant is it with thousands of issues?
A: (x) Not Answered No idea yet.
fields.summary: Allow the detail view to be closed on plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5941].
  {panel}

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Who has permission to simplify the workflow? Board owner or admin?
A: (/) Admin or Sys Admin

Q: If board owner is allowed, what if they don't have permissions to edit the workflow of the project?
A: N/A

Q: What if a simplified workflow already exists for this project?
A: Dialog prompt is not given.

Q: What about the resolve screen or modal dialogs from the last workflow?
A: All screens from previous workflow are removed.

Q: What will happen if the user is logged out/migration is interrupted during migration?
A: We now make one call to the server via REST, to both create the new (simplified) workflow scheme and to kick off the migration of the workflow.

Q: What if an issue is being transitioned during migration?
A: Whatever happens in JIRA will happen here.

Q: What if the user's security token is expired?
A: The XSRF token will no longer be used in this operation.

Q: What if the board filter is changed to include multiple projects when at the workflow migration dialog?
A: I'm assuming it will fail with an error.


# Deploying a fresh *JIRA 5.0.7* instance equipped with *GreenHopper 6.0.2*, tried to enable the *Simplify Workflow* button but it failed with the following error:
!migrate_failed.JPG!

# After that, authenticate as a user with the Administrator Access:
!admin_access.JPG!

# After that, the workflow migration works fine:
!migrate_success.JPG!

It would be useful if there is some sort of indication that shows the user does not have the Administrator Access. Perhaps next to the *Simplify Workflow* button.

Workaround to this issue: [Simplified Workflow button fails with "Workflow Migration did not complete successfully"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=301663531]
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow button fails with "Workflow Migration did not complete successfully" can be improved

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Create two boards for one project.
# Create a sprint on each board
# Create an issue
# Drag the issue into the sprint on board a

RESULT: Issue enters sprint on board b as well as board a

*Workaround*

Probably the best option is to label issues for the alpha board with the 'alpha' component, and then edit the filter that GreenHopper is using so that it uses that component and then set up the beta board in the same way. This will set up the two boards so that they're completely separate, and their sprints won't overlap.

The more advanced option is to set up the GreenHopper filter for one of the boards so that it uses a different rank field. This is done by creating a new field of the Global Rank type, and then editing the filter so that it sorts by that field in ascending order.
fields.summary: Multiple boards for one project - dragging issues into unrelated sprint impacts other board

(note wallboard gadget for same project works, classic one throws an error)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the message is only shown on Work Mode. There is no way for a user to know in Plan Mode if the Query Result Limit has been exceeded.

See screenshots. First shows that there are > 5000 issues on this board in mapped statuses. Second screenshot shows that only 8 issues are shown on Plan Mode, with no messaging.

*Possible Effect:*
Some issues may be missing and unable to be filtered by Quick Filters as Quick Filters only filter based on the issues on the board(not the actual filter). Thus, user might find some issues not appeared in the backlog even filter out using quick filters and will caused incomplete sprint planning.

*Plan*
- Display some message on plan mode when the limit is in effect 
- In configuration note that only this configuration item applies to the new boards as well
fields.summary: No Query Result Limit message is displayed in Plan Mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

# Create an empty board with swimlane strategy 'Stories'
# Create a story with 3 sub-tasks on this board
# Create another story with no sub-tasks, ranked below the first
# In GH Admin Config, set Query Result Limit to '2'
# Refresh board

Even though message for "Other Issues" swimlane is shown, no message is shown for the story swimlane, despite having some sub-tasks filtered.

Make sure this is also fixed for Assignee strategy.
fields.summary: Query Result Limit message is not shown when swimlane strategy is 'Assignees' or 'Stories'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See screenshot.

*Plan*
- Do not show warnings for specific swimlanes (show for whole board)
fields.summary: Display of 'swimlane exceeded' message could be improved

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a board with no swimlanes and 5 issues
# Rank the issues in a known order
# Create a swimlane which places the bottom ranked issue at the top of the board (e.g. by issue type or priority)
# Using GH Admin Config setting, set Query Result Limit to '1'
# Reload board

The first issue in the 'Everything Else' swimlane will be shown, instead of the issue which is in the top-most swimlane.

You could argue that this is not a bug, but it seems counter-intuitive.
fields.summary: Query Result Limit gives preference to rank regardless of swimlane order

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5934].
  {panel}

The DevTools Documentation board on JAC is broken in that you cannot go to Manage Board.

You can view the board data but you cannot manage its config.

I tried to copy the board and gets the same error.

I see absolutely nothing in the logs.  I am afraid we have a bug but we have poor coverage in the logs.

We need to investigate - 

The copy is here - https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=308 - called Copy of DevTools Documentation

We can be rough with this.  I think we need to get a JAC dump and start looking at this one.
fields.summary: Manage Board is not showing on DevTools board on JAC - nothing in the logs

Thanks

fields.description:
AO_60DB71_QUICKFILTER.QUERY is a varchar(255).

This has presented problems with some groups that have long component names.

Additionanlly, the equivalent field in Jira (searchrequest.reqcontent) is a text field, so there is inconsistent behavior in trying to reuse JQL from Jira within Greenhopper.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have >255 character Quick Filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I look at our rapidboard with our "Next Iteration" quickfilter set, I only see four issues:

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=23&view=planning&quickFilter=71

However, the equivalent query in JIRA (actually, a more restrictive query that only shows open issues) shows at least 80 results:

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+in+%28UPM%2C+AMKT%29+AND+fixVersion+%3D+%22Backlog+-+Next%22+AND+issuetype+%21%3D+Approval+AND+issuetype+%21%3D+%22Approval+Subtask%22+AND+%28component+%21%3D+Approvals+OR+component+%3D+EMPTY%29+AND+status+%3D+Open+ORDER+BY+Rank+ASC

An exemplar issue is https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-2797

Re-indexing JIRA has no effect.
fields.summary: Many issues not appearing on Ecosystem RapidBoard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I think that the drop down should be a favorites list that you can add or remove from.

Our instance has 385 projects and a lot of them have created rapid boards. So the problem then is that in order to go to a rapid board i need scroll down a really long list.

I understand that the agile tab in the top has a list of recent boards that i have visited. But what if I visit more than 5 boards often?
fields.summary: As a rapid board user I would like to be able to edit what is displayed in the available rapid board drop down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* Either JQL function, or change the fundamental clause handling to allow for these labels
* Use the epic label field to look up an epic and then use its ID in the Lucene query
* Don't consider autocomplete

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if there are epics with duplicate names (either globally or within the search scope)?
A: (/) They will all match so the issues list will be an union of all the issues of those matching epics

Q: What if the epic is closed/resolved?
A: (/) We are agnostic

Q: What if the epic label is empty? (is this even possible?)
A: (/) The epics with empty label won't match
fields.summary: Allow JQL for searching for all issues in an Epic via their "epic label"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using the Greenhopper Simplified Workflow Scheme and viewing an issue in JIRA, the current Status is a selectable option to change to.

For instance if it's in progress, then In Progress shows up as a Status option to change the issue to.

I realize this is due to not having transitions between Statuses, but it should be a simple check in the JIRA Issue View to remove the Current Status from the list of optional statuses.

This has already confused a couple of our users.
fields.summary: Current Workflow Status shouldn't show up as an Option in JIRA Issue View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: need to have the ability to search for issues by individual upcoming sprints so that the results can be viewed in gadgets.
fields.summary: need to be able to search on the upcoming sprints to use in filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user, I want to utilize the fix version to define sprints so that I can use the many gadgets and reporting options available with fix version (e.g. roadmaps, release notes, statistics, etc.).  
Currently, sprints are only available in GH; however, all of our backlog management, reporting, and dashboards are based on information Jira.  Sprints are a fix version because they have start date, end date, and release date - release date is the date associated with the actual deployment. 

Currently, it is also difficult to get a listing of all issues across sprints.  I need this for software capitalization, release notes, and support needs. Therefore, having this aligned within JIRA for use in the issue navigator, I am able to get this information easily.
fields.summary: Ability to align sprints with a fixversion

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please add a inline editor for "Fix Version/s", see attachment. Other fields would be nice too, but important for us is the "Fix Version/s".
fields.summary: Inline Editor for fixed Version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a manager, I want to be able to see sub-tasks on the rapid board to plan the sprints and transition them in work mode. I am pretty sure this can be done as long as your filter query is not too complicated. However, since we are using a custom field to identify the sprint team, when creating a new sub-task (e.g. via GH's detail view), the custom field cannot be automatically be set to the parent team. This causes us to lose the sub-tasks in the boards unless we include them via a JQL Tricks function which then causes a permission problem (GHS-5918) that does not allow to use 'Add Sprint' anymore.

We would really like to see support for sub-tasks and allowing them to be identified via it's parent.
fields.summary: Allow option to include sub-tasks into boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I am using the new Greenhopper Agile Planning Board (Scrum Flavor) with Estimation Statistic set to "Original Time Estimate" and Time Tracking set to "Remaining Estimate and time Spent".  I put a bunch of items on to my board and dragged a few up to the next planned sprint.  Our standard in my company is put the estimates on sub-tasks under the EPIC / STORY cards.  However, Greenhopper expects the estimate to be on the parent card and does not roll-up or include the estimate values in the child sub-tasks.  I feel this a huge limitation and should be added.  Given that other companies may have different preferences, feel free to add a check-box to the configuration of the board like [X] Include/roll-up sub-tasks in estimation.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Agile Planning Board Scrum - Sub-Task Estimates not Rolled Up on Plan tab

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It is quite difficult to describe what happens here, since we do not completely understand how GreenHopper calculates the permissions. However, all that really matters is that GreenHopper requires the 'Administer Project' permission for a user to allow him to use the 'Add Sprint' button on a rapid board.

We have created a GreenHopper board and we are now trying to include sub-tasks into the filter via the following query:

(project = ABC AND reporter = user1) OR issue in parent("project = ABC AND reporter = user1") ORDER BY Rank ASC

This actually works quite well as long as the parent() function returns something. If it returns an empty set, the 'Add Sprint' button is disabled and GreenHopper complains about a missing 'Administer Project' permission. We changed the query slightly by including two reporters thus forcing the parent() function to return an empty result:

(project = ABC AND reporter = user1) OR issue in parent("project = ABC AND reporter = user1 AND reporter = user2") ORDER BY Rank ASC

Now the 'Add Sprint' button is missing even though this JQL query return exactly the same issues as if we remove the parent() function completely ((project = ABC AND reporter = user1) ORDER BY Rank ASC).

I am not sure if this is problem relates to GreenHopper or JQLT therefore I created a bug report on both ends.
fields.summary: Permission issues when using JQL Tricks parent() function

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It used to be possible to switch between boards in this fashion, but it seems that at some point it's been removed. The "Agile" dropdown shows recent boards, but not _all_ of them.
fields.summary: Add ability to switch between all boards from the board name heading at the top left

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Acceptance Criteria
* Works also, when I don't have "Schedule Issues" permissions

When viewing the Task Board and create a new issue, that issue is not associated with the current sprint. Thus I have to go hunting for that issue in plan view and add it to the sprint, and then go back to the team board :( Currently this workaround won't even work, when the development team member does not have schedule issue permissions.
fields.summary: As a development team member, I want to add new issues to the task board so the team can self-organize during the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Error message : No permission to browse a created project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5914].
  {panel}

This was found on http://ecosystem.atlassian.net by [~jgordinier].

It is reported that [certain issues|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+in+%28UPM%2C+AMKT%29+AND+issuetype+%21%3D+Approval+AND+issuetype+%21%3D+%22Approval+Subtask%22+AND+%28component+%21%3D+Approvals+OR+component+%3D+EMPTY%29+AND+status+%21%3D+Triage+AND+%22Bonfire+Browser%22+is+not+empty+and+sprint+is+empty+and+resolution+%3D+Unresolved+ORDER+BY+Rank+ASC], which were raised with Bonfire, are not appearing on the [SF Ecosystem Rapid Board|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=23&view=planning].

An example of such an issue is UPM-2285. It appears in the search results when viewing the filter backing the board in Issue Navigator, but it does not appear on the board.

I have checked the following common causes:
* Status mapping - is *Open* status
* Sprint and Rank field configurations - all normal
* Empty Sprint field
* No active filters

What's interesting is that, when viewing the issue from View Issue page, if I choose the 'Go To Agile Board' operation, it attempts to go to the board, only to not find the issue (select it) once it gets there. Normally, when an issue does not appear on a board, the operation will fail.

Another interesting fact is that, once the issue is Ranked To Top/Bottom from View Issue page, it suddenly appears on the board. So you would think that it might be an indexing issue. But if I do a simple edit of the issue's description, this does not solve the problem. So it could be a problem with the rank index.

I do not have access to the logs to check what's going on -- this will be my next port of call.

*Workaround*

Bump the Query Result Limit on ecosystem.atlassian.net. You can safely bump it to 1500-2000; I imagine setting it to ~5000 wouldn't cause too much havoc;

Refine your board filter (or create a new board) to reduce the number of issues that appear in your backlog. One could argue that having ~5,000 issues in a backlog is not very manageable.
fields.summary: Issues raised with Bonfire do not show up on GreenHopper Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Clicking on board title when already editing owner field makes both editable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When copying an existing Rapid Board in the latest release, the list of Swimlanes is reversed causing the system default of "Everything Else" to move to the top and all user-defined values to appear below.  You cannot drag the user-defined values back above "Everything Else".  This results in no swimlanes on the board because all issues are grouped into "Everything Else" since it's stuck as the first on the list.  The only option is to delete all user-defined swimlanes and recreate them.
fields.summary: Swimlane list is inverted when copying an existing Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5911].
  {panel}

*Tested on a JIRA 5.1 clean instance with GH 6.0.2*

* Project A has a rapid board and has a sprint started called "Sprint A1".
* Project B has a rapid board and has a sprint started called "Sprint B1".
* An issue within Project B's sprint is cloned and moved into Project A. 
* Since the Sprint field retains the value from the Project B sprint, but it now becomes a part of Project A, the Project A's Rapid Board shows "Sprint A1" and "Sprint B1" simultaneously.

We expect that the clone and the move operations should take this into account and either clear the previous sprint information or at least prompt the user about it.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Plan mode of Rapid Board displays multiple sprints in progress

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the recent change to GH rapid boards, you now cannot switch between boards by clicking on the name of the current board and navigating to a new one. Instead, you have to click the arrow by "Agile". This is OK, but the list of boards now only shows your 5 most recent boards, whereas in the old model, you could see many more boards (it might have been all of them). We have many boards and frequently flip between them, so having to click on Agile, then "more", and then find your board and click on it is a little tedious. There is plenty of real estate to allow many more boards to be displayed in the Agile dropdown. I'd like to see at least my last 10 boards, if not 20 or more.
fields.summary: Allow for more rapid boards to be displayed in the Agile dropdown menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the latest revision (6.0.2) the QuickFilters now look like links in the Plan Mode.  It is often not apparent that one is enabled and as a result issues are not displayed due to a filter being enabled.
Please change these (e.g. to buttons) to make them more obvious.
fields.summary: QuickFilters not obvious enough in 6.0.2 - change them to buttons

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: GH error displayed on top of create issue dialog preventing input of some fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

When attempting to convert a simplified workflow the error "Workflow migration did not complete successfully." is generated, as in the attached screenshot.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The workflow is created successfully, or a more description error message of why it failed is generated.

h3. Workaround

# Go to the Workflow Schemes in Project Administration.
# There will be a Workflow Scheme named "GreenHopper Simplified Workflow Scheme for Project X".
# Modify the project so that it uses that scheme.
fields.summary: Custom Workflow error when converting to Simplified Workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Bug migrated from here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4879 (note: contains screenshots of bug)

Originally a bug found in GreenHopper 5.10.3.

Observed:

1) Set up a parent - child fix version relationship
2) Create a new issue using the JIRA interface
3) Update the story points and time tracking information
4) Set the fix version to the child fix version
5) Confirm
6) Go to GreenHopper classic planning board.
7) Observe time tracking information updated correctly for both parent and child fix versions.
8) Observe story points only updated for child fix version

Expected:

All fields are updated correctly, not just time tracking.
fields.summary: Not all fields are updated correctly on Classic Chart Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to our description at [Removing an Issue from a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Removing+an+Issue+from+a+Sprint]:

{quote}
To remove an issue from the active sprint,

    Log in to JIRA.

    Click the Agile link's down-arrow in the top navigation bar, then select your preferred board from the resulting dropdown menu.
    Your board will be displayed.
    Either:
        Click Plan, then drag the issue out of the planned sprint and into another sprint or into the backlog.
        or:
        Click Work, then click the issue key to display the Issue Detail View. Select Remove from Sprint from the cog menu (see screenshot below).
    (info) Note that you cannot remove a sub-task from a sprint, as sub-tasks always belong to the same sprint as their parent.
{quote}

On the Plan mode, dragging and dropping the issue from the active sprint doesn't work. You can only reorder the issues on the active sprint by using the drag and drop.
fields.summary: Removing an issue from an active sprint on Plan mode not working as documented

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Jira by itself has become quite useless once we switched our projects over to the Simplified workflow since issues that are resolved and closed now don't have resolutions anymore. The solution of manually changing the workflow to contain resolutions is not a good workaround since this means we lose the flexibility of the simplified workflows. Instead there should be an option to configure the resolutions of final states. Resolved => resolution = resolved
Closed => resolution = closed
This would even open up the possibility to introduce new final states like
Rejected
Duplicate 
Irrelevant
all could have a resolution matching the status that way Jira recognizes resolved issues as such and graphs like the created vs resolved and others work correctly again. Also the strike through of an issue that is completed would work again.
fields.summary: As user of the simplified workflow in a project that has been converted I want the resolved and closed states to have issue resolutions so that Jira recognises them outsidde of greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When in the Rapid Board, I used to be able to switch on the fly between admin view and user view. Now when I go into Configure Board, there is no button to go back to viewing the board so I have to navigate back to it the long way (via menus).
fields.summary: No quick ability to go back into using the rapid board once you've entered the boards admin panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Printing Issues in Cards Form doesn't work properly when using a very long description

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It seems like a user not having Create Shared Object permission and who therefore is not able to share a filter is still able to create an agile board (via create board advanced tab) based on a filter shared by someone else and then this board will be available to everyone who can see the filter. I like to be able to prevent users from sharing stuff but still be able to share filters with them. Either the board should not be created and an error message be given (as is the case if the user try to create a board based on a project), or only personal filters should be available to select from when creating the board.

This issue is created after suggestion in JST-44875.
fields.summary: Agile boards shared by users not having create shared object permission

Needs some research
Includes text-selection v editing

Image of header displaying days:

!header.png!
fields.summary: Sprint header should show time according to the default format

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When creating a board for an existing project/s, currently the statuses chosen are from the JIRA default workflow, which may or may not be applicable to the projects chosen. We want to choose ones that make sense for those projects instead.
fields.summary: As a user creating a board off an existing project I would like the column status mapping to include actual mapped statuses (not others)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There's a message at the top of the "Enabled Projects" section in GreenHopper's admin pages that says:

{quote}The configuration options below only apply to Classic Planning Board, Classic Task Board, Classic Chart Board and Classic Released Board.{quote}

However, this also seems to control whether the drop-down menu next to the "Agile" item at the top of JIRA appears. If a user has access only to projects that aren't specifically "GreenHopper-enabled" projects, even though they can get into the Rapid Board the drop-down never shows and it's much less obvious how to find the boards (upon clicking "Agile" you end up at the "Getting Started" screen).

*Plan*
Always show the drop down unless the user does not have permissions to browse any projects
fields.summary: Drop down arrow for the Agile menu does not appear when user does not have access to any "GreenHopper enabled projects"

fields.description: In Greenhopper 6.0.1, when a sprint was completed using the Scrum board, a new Fix/Version was created and all tickets were assigned to this version. This is no longer the case. Now in 6.0.2, the sprint is released but no new Fix/Version is created.
fields.summary: Completing a sprint does not create a version when using Scrum board

fields.description: I would like to be able to use the "." keyboard shortcut to remove a card from the active sprint. Right now I have to click on the title of the issue to open the issue details panel on the right hand side, click on the wrench menu and select the "Remove from sprint" options.
fields.summary: Add "Remove from sprint" to the "." operations menu

fields.summary: User without 'Create Shared Objects' permission is allowed to create Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Using GH 6.0.2 I was able to notice that users who don't belong to the "JIRA Administrators" group are not able to change a Board owner, even though they're the current owner of the board. 
Tried adding Project Permissions and Global Permissions and I was able to change the owner only after adding the user to the "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Board owner cannot be changed unless you're a JIRA Administrator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getLinksForSection'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a PO, I would like to have the ability to use a different set of issuetypes in GreenHopper (as against what is available in JIRA)
fields.summary: As as PO I would like to have different issuetypes in GreenHopper for the project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to reset the detail view fields to default

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Upgrade task
- All the existing fields on the detail tab of the detail view in the same order they are there atm
- Newly created boards should have the default set up

NOTE: We should lock the Rapid View when an upgrade is in progress.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if one of these fields does not exist?
A: (/) Not possible to delete, but you can hide the field. It is not visible on detail view, but its listed on the detail view configuration.

Q: What if one of these fields has been renamed?
A: (/) No rename option available for system fields

Q: What if there is a custom field named with same name?
A: (/) No special handling in this case - works as expected.

Q: Is there any difference for in-line editable fields vs non-editable?
A: (/) We are only doing this for fields in Detail Section

Q: What happens if you remove a default field after the upgrade task?
A: (/) Its not possible to delete system fields from JIRA

Q: This needs to be tested on all databases.
A: (/) OK

Q: What older versions of the data do we need to be wary of? What about pre- Detail View data?
A: (/) Should be handled automatically by AO staff

Q: What if fields are not in the expected order?
A: (/) The order in this case does not matter -   we will add those fields which are not already present there.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the existing fields included by default in the detail view to be configurable like for custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is just the first step in flagging

COS: 
- Flag is set / cleared from the cog menu in detail view & context menu
- Flag icon takes place of issue priority
- background color change when issue flagged (also specific color when selected)
- Appear in work mode and plan mode
- use the flag field introduced in classic mode :
-- not empty -> flagged
-- empty -> un flagged
- in case of mixed selection propose "flag" action, else propose the opposite action of the selection
- in case of multiple issues flagging with error :
-- flag the one that can be modified
-- display a list of info message "issue key -> error"
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like basic flagging of issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Phase 1:
Hover state with outline and pencil icon.

All inline edits + some edit affordances that trigger dialogs for the actual edit (I assume at some point these will converge)

Inline edits:
Detail view - Summary, estimate, remaining est, rollup est, description
Config: Board name, owner, filter, column names, column constraints, Work JQL (Kanban)
Plan mode: Upcoming sprint name, active sprint name, active sprint dates
Work mode (Scrum): Sprint name, sprint dates
fields.summary: Adopt the Kick Ass visuals for inline editing in the detail view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Support is finding that many customers have questions on GH6, but usually when we give the customer the 101 docs: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+101 
and also the youtube video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57xYGGbBemE

This answers most their questions, can we get the youtube clip on the 101 page to have everything in the one place?
fields.summary: GreenHopper 101 doc, can it feature the youtube video?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have added an issue to an active sprint (scope change). I can see the issue in the Work mode but it is not showing up in the Plan mode.
fields.summary: An issue added to an active sprint (scope change) is not showing up in the Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a user, I'm not able to delete attachments from the JIRA Agile / Software issue detail view.

h3. Suggested Solution

I would like to be able to delete attachments in issues.
 
h3. Workaround 

Open the issue in the JIRA view issue page and delete the attachment there. This can be done by opening the issue detail link in a new tab (such as using middle mouse click).
fields.summary: Allow to delete attachments

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to select multiple issues and remove them from the current sprint. Right now, I need to do this one by one.
fields.summary: Allow to do "Remove from sprint" for multiple issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are putting several issue types onto a rapidboard and estimate them via story points. However, we also want to be able to track time for particular issue types (e.g. technical tasks). If we enable Time Tracking on the board, we can enter a remaining estimate for stories even though time tracking is disabled for stories in the field configuration.

This leads to inconsistency and confuses our users. Is there any way of showing this field only for the correct issue types?
fields.summary: Remaining estimate can be entered for issue types that have time tracking disabled via field configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Detail view has the option to add links, it ought to be possible to remove them too.
fields.summary: Add ability to remove issue links on Detail view, not just add them

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Can still create multi sprints even if parallel sprints feature turned off

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Sample data description for deleting the project uses weird terminology ("in the description for this card")

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: The quick filter sample data item for Kanban is not a good one because the filter will cause the issue itself not to be selected (and the detail view to close)
